title: Tuesday, 6th November 2018
bodyHTML:
11:07 am
BE11:07am

Hello.

BE11:08am

Phew, market reporting is super fun isn't it?

jaws gm
Blank canvas morning
GBKrona Hola
#REF! hello
Viking1 Morning
BE11:08am

(This is Markets Live, BTW. FT Alphaville's daily whatever.)

GBKrona Politics reigns supreme today and last few weeks - great deals out there for patient investors
11:09 am
BE11:09am

So ...... basically how it works now is that we can write "markets edge lower amid skittish confidence and mixed earnings reports as America goes to the polls in a crucial referendum on the presidency of ....."

Soundbuy Oi
BE11:10am

Or we can write something that's actually happening in the market and get fined 40k.

BE11:10am

https://www.pressg...e+Daily+new+layout

VV75 morning
11:10 am
BE11:10am

Which creates some difficult decisions.

BE11:11am

For example, there's been a pretty lively rumour whipping around the market for the past day or so.

Soundbuy We'll crowd fund your £40k..........
Blank canvas in today's FT, Robert Shrimsley's piece on UK's role in the world after Brixit is first rate. The man deserves a pay rise irrespective of how much he earns: https://www.ft.com/content/29468d52-e0e5-11e8-8e70-5e22a430c1ad
BE11:12am

And by repeating it here I'd need to trust the reader to understand what a rumour is, and why a journalist would be placing it into the public domain.

Alchemy30 You can trust us :-)
11:13 am
BE11:13am

Even when every single conversation they'd had over the past 24 hours suggested the rumour should be treated with extreme caution.

VV75 fair warning
BE11:14am

Fugu-level RAW

VV75 fugu no less, now I am excited
BE11:15am

And in that case the RAW disclaimer isn't entirely right. We've tested the info through every channel available to us and what's come back has given us no. reason whatsoever to believe what we're about to say is accurate.

Arbageddon Sounds awesome
11:15 am
BE11:16am

Which doesn't mean it's not accurate. It just means we have been given no reason to believe that it is. If you see what I mean. Phew.

Waterloo Bank?
GBKrona @Blank Canvas - yes, excellent article by Robert Shrimsley
Forester Trump wears a syrup?
Alchemy30 Fevertree mk2
BE11:17am

So ........... here's a Numis note from yesterday.

BE11:17am

BT Group
Share price likely to keep climbing

11:17 am
BE11:17am

Yep, maybe!

BE11:17am

Or not. We don't know. TO BE CLEAR.

Roidster hello guys!
Alchemy30 Any names attached ?
BE11:18am

All we can say currently is this: there's a suggestion being heard from multiple places in the market that Deutsche Telekom has recently been working with advisors on the long-rumoured full takeover of BT.

Blank canvas BE: this is a real case of "Brace yourself Effie"
11:18 am
BE11:19am

It has also been rumoured in multiple places in the market that high-level discussions have happened between the companies very recently.

BE11:19am

Now, clearly, there are a lot of moving parts to this theory.

BE11:20am

Firstly the BT-DT standstill agreement, which doesn't expire until next year.

11:20 am
BE11:20am

Secondly the DT-Sprint regulatory process, which is ongoing.

GBKrona @BE- BT just jumped up 2% since you typed above
Paper Chase Oooh it's like the Unilever session all over again. I'm excited for the next 40 minutes or so...
Viking1 Orange still got a holding ?
BE11:22am

Thirdly, it's far from a new idea. Chris Williams at the Telegraph has been writing it every other month for half a decade: https://www.telegr...t-for-Germans.html

Tony Scott Surely the CMA would be all over a merger like this
Tony Scott Whenever a British institution is subject to takeover, Parliament seems to put its two cent in as well
chopper bear its out now - come on BT put out a statement - iv been wanting out of BT for ages lol
BE11:24am

All we can say is that there's definitely a specific rumour in the darker corners of the market right now suggesting things have moved and, by making it public here, we are only seeking to let sunlight be the disinfectant.

11:24 am
undefined
BE11:24am

Okay! Onto other matters.

BE11:25am

Markets are edging lower amid skittish confidence and mixed earnings reports as America goes to the polls in a crucial referendum on the presidency of ..... actually, let's not do that either.

11:25 am
BE11:25am

Morrison?

WM Morrison Supermarkets PLC (MRW:LSE): Last: 240.20, down 14.35 (-5.64%), High: 246.15, Low: 239.90, Volume: 4.64m
BE11:26am

Retail LFL's much. much weaker than expected.

wayneJ Did DT not own T-Mobile in the UK which was merged with Orange to create EE which was bought by BT (which had previously owned O2 which was sold to Telefonica). So DT buying BT would mean buying EE which DT had sold to BT?
11:27 am
BE11:27am

Conference call with management was slightly odd. Gist seemed to be that they expected retail to have a bad quarter post the exceptional second quarter (weather, World Cup) but didn't manage to nudge the sellside hard enough into taking their figures down.

Viking1 Purplebricks?
BE11:27am

The result is 6% off live, which feels a bit sharp based on no change to consensus.

BE11:28am

Goldman blames profit taking.

GBKrona @WayneJ - they'd just by it back at a big discount!
11:28 am
BE11:28am

Morrisons (Neutral) reported 3Q19 Group LFL ex fuel of +5.6%, below company compiled consensus of +6.1%, with Retail ex-fuel LFL of +1.3% below Consensus of +1.8%. Wholesale LFL was in line with expectations at +4.3%. Within Retail LFL, online sales contributed +0.3%, a step up from +0.2% in 2Q19. Management do not make an outlook comment. While we do not expect material changes to consensus PBT estimates for FY19, on balance, given the Retail LFL miss and the stock’s strong performance YTD (+16% vs European food retail coverage +3%), we expect the stock to underperform following this print.

wayneJ BT = EE + Open Reach + BT Retail + BT TV + pension fund. Two of those items have negative value; one is subject to regulator review and possible forced separation and the others are under price pressure?
BE11:29am

And Caz, who are happy.

BE11:29am

Morrison 3Q Group LFL ex-fuel/ex-VAT beat again expectations at +5.6% (JPMe +2.4%) led by wholesale. Retail LFL of +1.3% came within the range of expectations, we believe (JPMe +1.4%), albeit eased by 120bp sequentially QoQ. This might disappoint some but it is worth noting that 2Q was exceptional as benefited from World cup and weather tailwinds, whilst there was separately lower inflation in 3Q vs 2Q. All in all we see the performance as solid.

11:30 am
BE11:30am

And SocGen, who aren't.

BE11:30am

Feedback from the conference call 1) The slowdown in LFL Retail sales in 3Q (1.3% vs 2.5% in 2Q) was expected by the group but not by consensus, as suggested by the c.4% stock decline. 2) Management mentioned that Retail volumes were positive. 3) Management declined to comment on earnings consensus (FY underlying PBT of £409m / SGe: £398m) but said that, if they were uncomfortable with consensus, under regulatory disclosure requirements they would be obliged to make a statement to that effect. So, we think consensus is unlikely to change significantly at this stage. 4) We see growing investor concern about wage inflation in the sector.

BE11:32am

Cautious fundamental view: In all, this publication strengthens our cautious fundamental view. The valuation is excessive, in our view (2018e P/E ratio of 20.1x vs 19.7x for Tesco and 15.3x for Sainsbury’s / better margin trend for Tesco) and operating leverage has proved disappointing over the past 18 months (flat EBIT margin).

11:32 am
undefined
BE11:33am

PurpleBricks? The London market's best spoonerism? Sure.

Purplebricks Group PLC (PURP:LSE): Last: 185.40, up 4.1 (+2.26%), High: 198.90, Low: 180.50, Volume: 1.05m
Viking1 Their cash burn , quite “ impressive”
11:34 am
BE11:34am

Trading update's fine. In line. Nothing changes.

VV75 Weir is up a bit today on figures.
BE11:34am

Growth achieved in the UK's stagnating market.

BE11:35am

The cost of that growth, and the likelihood of repeat custom, are questions. But they were yesterday as well, and today's update doesn't really change anyone's opinion.

11:35 am
BE11:36am

Peel Hunt, for instance, is still buying.

BE11:36am

A solid H1 trading update leaves the group on track to meet FY
guidance set out in July (revenues of £165m-£185m). In the UK,
share gains continue in a challenging second-hand market, while
growth in international markets is encouraging. We make no
changes to forecasts (PH revenue forecast of £173m for FY19)
and continue to expect the group to make a profit in FY21. On
current forecasts, the shares trade on a FY21 EV/Sales of 1.23x
and EV/EBITDA of 21x. Remains a Buy.

BE11:36am

n the UK, share gains continue in a challenging second-hand market, with revenues ahead by c20% with double-digit growth in instructions and a rise in average revenue per instruction. Average listings per LPE in the last three months has stepped up materially compared to the same period last year – an increase per LPE of c25%, reflecting the improving maturity profile and customer offering. Purplebricks continues to be the dominant player in the online/hybrid sector, with market share of 74% achieved in October. This is despite increased competition and total category media spend in the sector increasing 80%. Purplebricks leads the UK agent market in brand awareness, with aided awareness of 97% and unaided awareness of 48%.

chad_john BT's Brycebump immediately sold down.
11:37 am
BE11:37am

"Aided/unaided awareness" means they've seen an advert, right?

chad_john It might be a little bit more in the price than one would think
Viking1 Thanks
BE11:38am

(@chad_john: I honestly couldn't give a toss about share prices. I'm not a trader.)

chad_john @BE - I know, sorry, was pointing out more for discussion about whether it's already anticipated or not
BE11:39am

That's a weird metric to give rather than, for instance, how many houses they sell.

11:39 am
BE11:39am

Here's Citi. Also buyers.

BE11:40am

UK revenue growth in 1H19 came in at +20% YoY (Citi FY19e estimate of +32%) with instructions growing at double-digit rates. From our proprietary analysis we quantify this as c.15%, with our full year forecasts estimating +18% instruction volume growth. Market share gains have been achieved despite an environment of increased competition from incumbents where Purplebricks estimate media spend in the sector to have increased +80%. We highlight the upside opportunity from increased revenue per instruction which we believe FY19e will deliver further momentum. Note that UK revenue per instruction has increased at a CAGR of +18% to FY18, with a further increase put through in November 2018 which will support 2H19 revenue improvement.

BE11:40am

Australia Struggles Addressed – The Australian business has underperformed in the short term with our data suggesting as much as a c.30% decline in instruction volumes. However, the company re-launched its campaign in October 2018 to adjust its offering to better suit the local market conditions which helped drive a +35% growth in new instructions vs. September. This includes a change in pricing model to paying half upfront and half at the end, and including the full marketing fee within the package as it becomes more relevant as the broader market slows. Whilst still early, signs suggest a return in momentum.

11:41 am
BE11:41am

 Implies a Strong US Contribution – To achieve the low end of revenue guidance we model a £23m contribution from the US, up from £2m in the prior period. While difficult to track, we acknowledge that FY19e will include 12 months contribution from California as well as the expansion into at least 6 additional states which significantly expands the addressable market. At October end, Purplebricks had 140 local real estate experts and sales consultants. Brand awareness in California has reached 44%, ahead of UK when compared on similar post-launch timelines.
 Implications – While there is limited new information in the qualitative trading update, we continue to see value in the longer term opportunity.

Waterloo What happened to the previous RAW on SLN? All very quiet since.
BE11:42am

Which is all lovely and everything. Wonder how many houses it sells?

undefined
11:42 am
BE11:43am

(@Waterloo: haven't heard anything more.)

Waterloo Silence. How apt.
BE11:45am

So ............ what else? IWG?

IWG Plc (IWG:LSE): Last: 253.00, up 16.1 (+6.80%), High: 260.10, Low: 229.90, Volume: 2.33m
11:46 am
BE11:46am

Numbers fine. Comment that it "continues" to look for ways to dig out value is the interesting bit.

BE11:47am

Which effectively confirms that Dixon, having failed to get the price he wanted from PE, has been considering the plan B.

nichoman not much reaction to sunday times story on iwg (op co / prop co split). but maybe op co prop co a bit old hat now
BE11:48am

Such as selling its WeWork-alike, as we reported, or splitting into propco-opco, as the Sunday Times reported.

11:48 am
BE11:48am

Here's Stifel.

BE11:48am

A good 3Q with mature growth improving to 3.9% (vs 2.4% in 1H18A) and no change to full-year profit expectations. Guidance remains for £230m of net growth capex, with year-end leverage expected to be slightly higher than the half-year (1.1x). There is a greater focus on franchising opportunities in the statement than previously, which currently covers 115 locations with a strong pipeline of opportunities. The group "continues to explore a range of strategic opportunities" to deliver increased returns for shareholders, and our sense is that franchising will become a greater part of the mix going forward.

BE11:49am

Greater focus on franchising. Over the past few days media reports have suggested that the group is exploring splitting IWG between separate property and franchising businesses (Sunday Times, Sky News). Franchising is more in focus in the statement, with the group signing agreements for the development of 25 locations over the near term, taking the group total to 115. The franchisees pays up-front for the franchise and an annual fee for use. There is a strong pipeline of opportunities.

11:49 am
BE11:50am

Is the idea here to make IWG the IHG of temporary office space? I guess it might work.

BE11:50am

Outlook. The forward order book has strengthened and the group expects to see the benefits of this in 4Q. The board remains confident that the group will deliver results in line with management's expectations (Stifel adj. operating profit £157.5m). The board continues to explore a range of potential strategic opportunities to deliver increased value and returns for shareholders. The group expects to increase franchising activity, and is in discussions with a number of parties to partner across continents.

BE11:50am

They're on hold.

11:50 am
BE11:51am

Whilst we believe IWG is well placed to benefit from secular change in the flexible workspace market, recent trading has disappointed and we remain cautious on near-term outlook in the UK.

BE11:51am

And RBC are sellers.

BE11:52am

We like the market position and long-term fundamentals BUT EPS momentum has been negative, PE bids have not been forthcoming and management credibility remains low. The aggressive expansion continues, which is still dampening profits ensuring that the story remains jam tomorrow. We remain at Underperform, believing risk reward is not in favour and that it will take time to rebuild confidence, although today’s statement will help in that process.

dorsetcontrarian 'I honestly coundn't give a toss about share prices' - is this the FTs gerald ratner moment?
11:52 am
undefined
urgeview dorset ...stop being a tw...
BE11:54am

(@dorsetcontrarian: not really. I've said it repeatedly. Couldn't care less,)

dorsetcontrarian here we are trying to talk about share prices and some cu## wants to talk about tw###.........
BE11:56am

Afraid I'm very much behind on the GAM story, which is here: https://www.ft.com...-79c6-9ee84234f3e2

11:56 am
BE11:56am

(@Dorset, Urgeview: these are the commenting guidelines: http://www.ft.com/...lp/comments-policy

#trader TY, stock got squeezed this morn +6% now down 5%
BE11:57am

(If either of you breach them once more your ability to comment will be removed. Got it?)

VV75 you're lenient today
BE11:58am

That's post the recent rebuff of Schroders https://www.ft.com...-a854-33d6f82e62f8

madrugada Wmh?
dorsetcontrarian got it......sorry.........he started it!
11:59 am
BE11:59am

Wonder if anyone covers this trainwrecck? Oh, Baader does.

BE12:00pm

In our view, stepping down of Mr. Friedman is not particularly surprising considering the substantial amount of shareholder pressure and criticism, which has yet magnified following a loss of Absolute Return Bond Fund product. We believe that stepping down of Mr. Friedman will be taken positively by the market and think that GAM continues to be a take-over target.
In the meantime, we note that, according to our fund data sample, GAM’s AuM in the wholesale business is down approx. 5%, led by approx. 3% outflows (

CHF 0.5bn) with negative NNA across the whole fund spectrum. However, the outflow pace seems to be lower mom (September at approx. -5%).

Overall, GAM’s investment case seems to have a roughly balanced risk/reward (perhaps slightly skewed to the latter). On the negative side, the likelihood of continued outflows as a result of damaged reputation remains relatively high, on the positive side: surplus cash somewhat limits the downside potential and GAM is a take-over target. HOLD.

undefined
12:01 pm
BE12:01pm

Quick line on William Hill, since it's a request.

William Hill PLC (WMH:LSE): Last: 206.70, down 6.9 (-3.23%), High: 209.80, Low: 194.45, Volume: 5.63m
1st Lt. Fletcher Christian Warren Buffett once said he would be happy if the stock market were to close for five years. What is importance is underlying business activity. Day to day share prices are for the birds and morons IMO.
Maverick WMH - UBS keeps as buy after numbers 300p price target.
BE12:02pm

So, stock had been supported in recent days by ............... UBS, was it? .... pushing the US-is-undervalued case.

12:02 pm
BE12:02pm

Today we get a "short term pain, long term gain" soft of statement.

BE12:03pm

Q3's weak.

BE12:03pm

Here's Goldman.

Blank canvas thanks for everything today. :)
12:03 pm
BE12:04pm

William Hill released a trading update this morning (November 6) for the 17 weeks ended October 23, 2018, reporting net revenue growth of -4% yoy (vs. +3.1% in 1H18) , driven by a 5% net revenue fall in Online and 4% decline in Retail revenue.

BE12:04pm

Management issued FY18 EBIT guidance of £225-245mn, compared to
company-compiled consensus of £243mn (GSe £226mn) which we believe will put pressure on the share price today. Management also provided guidance on dividend payments, expecting to based them on underlying earnings including US expansion going forward from FY19 but capped at 9 per share. Given consensus did not reflect a drop in dividend payment following the FOBT stakes cut (company compiled consensus FY19 11.6p vs GSe 9.4p and FY17 DPS of 13.4p), we expect this to be also taken negatively.

BE12:04pm

But against that you have America.

12:04 pm
BE12:05pm

As per Morgan Stanley.

BE12:05pm

[W]e are drawn to the company's separate statement ahead of today's CMD with a new target for the US business: an ambition of $300m EBITDA by 2023. This is 5-6x larger than our 2022 forecast for the division, and comparable to our (ex-US) group EBITDA forecast for 2022. If management can give confidence at the CMD that this target is (even somewhat) realistic, we would expect the shares to perform positively, given it implies the value of the US business could be bigger than the current market cap of £1.8bn. William Hill is the most geared play to the US online sports betting market in our coverage, and we rate the shares Overweight with more than 40% implied upside to our 290p price target.

BE12:06pm

Hence the selloff, then the rally.

Soundbuy Aye, cheers.......
12:06 pm
undefined
urgeview Cheers for BT!!
BE12:06pm

Heh. Aren't journalists ridiculous.

BE12:07pm

(Including myself, to be clear. Especially myself.)

12:08 pm
BE12:08pm

They genuinely don't seem to understand that they're never the first to find out things in the market. Generally speaking, they're the last.

Viking1 Not like the good old days ?
BE12:09pm

And always guarding the right to claim exclusives like that word even means anything, except to a dozen people inside the little cabal of this weird dying industry.

BE12:10pm

Anyway! We're done.

GBKrona thanks @BE
VV75 ta
12:10 pm
BE12:10pm

Thanks for the comments. Back tomorrow, probably.

Paper Chase Someone give Bryce a hug.
BE12:11pm

Afternoon all.

Viking1 Thanks
Maverick Cheers
